intro: Priogymnanthus, commonly known as the African sandthorn, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to southern Africa and consists of several species, including Priogymnanthus africanus and Priogymnanthus ramosus. These plants are shrubs or small trees characterized by their spiny stems and small, yellowish-green flowers. The leaves are usually alternate, simple, and have a rough texture. The fruit is a capsule that contains numerous seeds, and the plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
